# Still Looking for Morphine

Still Looking for Morphine (Πες στη Μορφίνη Ακόμα την Ψάχνω) is a 2001 Greek drama film directed by Yannis Fagras. The film is set against the backdrop of industrial wastelands and docked ships in the port city of Piraeus, offering a rare view into a world of petty theft, drug use, and lazy summer days. The narrative follows Ricky, portrayed by Ekavi Douma, as she navigates real and imagined dangers, leading to her transformation by the end of summer.
The film was co-written by Yannis Fagras and Nicole Roussou, with cinematography by Panayotis Salapatas. The cast includes Ekavi Douma as Ricky, Panagiotis Karras, Nikos Pomonis, Iosif Polyzoidis, and Christina Frangiadaki.
Still Looking for Morphine received critical acclaim, winning the Association of Greek Film Critics Award for Best Film at the 42nd Thessaloniki International Film Festival in 2001. Sight and Sound magazine hailed it as one of cinema history’s “75 hidden gems.”
